about_the_game:
Good afternoon, random traveler. By the will of fate, you ended up here, on the page of this little game. And since you're here, why don't you give me a chance to read this description?

Today is little Lisa's birthday, her mom's birthday! But Lisa got into trouble, she has no money for a gift to her beloved mother. However, she is not upset and is going to spend the whole day to get money for a gift. But will the child be able to please his mother? That's the answer you're going to get.

Game Features:

• Duration of the game. The game takes about 30 minutes to complete. It's just a short story that doesn't pretend to be a whole week of your life.

• A concise ending. The end of the game literally describes the whole plot in one sentence. This is my tribute to Ernest Hemingway (in my native language, even the number of words matches.).

• A mundane story. This game is not about monsters, gods, or other fantasy characters. It's about life, about what each of us can go through, so the story can hook you more than saving another world with the power of friendship.

• Combat system. There is only one short combat episode in the game. Therefore, the game lacks a leveling system and long difficult battles. This game is more about a mundane story than about fighting and saving the world.

• The game has the ability to interact with the environment. At least half of the game is based on this.

• Inappropriate characters. Some events and characters may seem meaningless, but... all in good time.

• Focus on the story. When creating the game, all my attention was spent on writing a short, but still, I hope, interesting story. There are no beautiful graphics and amazing gameplay here. Here you will find the story of a girl who wanted to please her mother on her birthday.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Processor: Intel Pentium III 800 MHz
  • Memory: 512 MB RAM
  • Storage: 700 MB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectSound Compatible

short_description: Here is a short story about little Lisa, who wants to congratulate her mother on her birthday. But the child has no money for a present. Lisa has to look for ways to earn money for a present all day. But is there any sense in this? Maybe the girl shouldn't strain herself so much for such a mother?
